OOC:  Bye, I am going to miss our arguements, now I have to argue 
with someone else.  Any takers?


--- In nbwrpg@y..., "Vincent Price" <thecode@p...> wrote:
> OOC: Ah, OOC, I'm as formal as ever. Well? Surprised by the title? 
Well, I guess that it had to come to this eventually. I know I've 
said "I'll be with this RPG through thick and thin!" but then I 
thought about it and realized what I had said and wondered...Why? Why 
should I stay in an RPG that I just do not find as fun as I used to. 
Why should I stay in an RPG when I'm not even interested in 
Transformer's anymore, unless their G1. And why should I stay with an 
RPG like NBW when I have as much fun as I do in my own RPG, 
http://www.dbzsf.vze.com <Shameless self promotion. I know nobody 
will miss me, probably, because nobody ever really liked my posts. 
So, like Alloran, and Zardus, and Jer, and Lurker, and many other 
greats before me, I'm retiring. Sorry it had to come to this. Let's 
see here, what should I say in my speech? Well, here it comes.
> 
> First of all, thank you Alloran. You were what kept me in NBW over 
the times, and all, and you were always fair to me and even became my 
friend when I yelled out a horrible "SCREW YOU!" Which was just wrong 
of me, it really was. Alloran, I treasured the times we used to make 
fun of Liono and the things we used to say about JP! Oh, man! I had 
fun, true fun.
> 
> Lurker, you are one of my greatest friends, too. At first I didn't 
understand you, but then I realized that we were so much alike that 
we were meant to be friends. It's a twist of fate.
> 
> Jer, you da man! There, in your own words, even, Jer. You sure did 
make me feel bad for not talking to you in a while when you put me at 
the top of your mail. Well, you are one of the ELITE man. Seriously. 
It's great to be your friend. JUME!!!!
> 
> Jeff, you were one of the greatest moderators this RPG has ever 
seen. Your brand of fairness and punishment is unrivaled by any of 
the voted on Moderators. You were also a good friend, and I also had 
fun talking with you.
> 
> RoboRick, you are similar to me in several ways. Except your RPGing 
skills were never as crappy as mine started out as. HAW! But really, 
it's fun talking to you and if you win your bid for Council Member, 
well, congratulations, you deserve it. You are a good RPGer, and I 
hope that you have fun while I'm gone.
> 
> Zardus, you, I've had a very unusual relationship with. I first 
really met you when you called me an idiot for having Sinesis sweep 
up  your guy, who was it? I can't remember now, but the point is, 
that we soon became friends. If it was not for Zardus, I would never 
be the RPGer I am today, he showed me the way to do things, and I'll 
never go back to the ALL CAPS NO SPACES NO PARAGRAPHS NO SENSE guy I 
was before. I mean, I could only think about myself until I received 
the ultimate tutor in Zardus. Besides that, Zardus was always fair to 
me, helping me out when I had problems with other RPGers.
> 
> Cyberwolf, Airly, you 2 are cool with me. Cyberwolf takes the RPG 
very seriously, and is a great RPGer. Airly, you've been great, a 
good friend. I'm sure the 2 of you can keep NBW alive in the future.
> 
> Logo: I don't really know what to say, besides that you were a 
great friend. I'm sorry I never got one of my characters in a 
relationship with one of yours. Truly.
> 
> Finally, Minime_316. Thanks. RIP my friend.
> 
> Well, I guess that's it. Anyone who wishes to keep in contact with 
me can e-mail me at my god awful e-mail address, thecode@p... Now, 
for a list! A list of every character I've ever had in this RPG! It's 
going to be beautiful! Here it comes! (Make sure to read on past it, 
too)
> 
> 
> Deemos
> Sharpedge
> Banzai-Tron
> Godfather

> 
> And finally, I end things by saying. Good luck, keep this RPG 
going, I know you can do it.
> 
> WHAT?
> 
> WHAT?
> 
> WHAT?
> 
> WHAT?
> 
> WHAT?
> 
> BOO YAA!
> 
> JUME!
> 
> WOOD!
> 
> WHAT?
> 
> THE END! Seriously. I love you all! GOODBYE!...
> 
> Roland the Last Gunslinger, Blaine the Mono, Heap of Broken Images, 
Soulstice, Soulstice Omega, Key and Rose, Tick Tock Man, Fear in a 
Handful of Dust, SCREAM, Vincent Price
> 
> Don't trouble trouble, until trouble troubles you!
> (Get Game Informer magazine)
> 
> REAL The End!
> 
> PS: Remember me!
>

Bye...................................................................
